intro: Dichapetalum obliquifolium var. mayumbensis, commonly known as the Mayumbensis flame tree, is a striking tropical plant characterized by its large, showy red flowers that resemble flames. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is native to parts of Central and South America. The plant has palmately lobed leaves that are typically green and glossy, providing a striking contrast to its vibrant floral display. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental species in warmer climates. Its unique appearance and seasonal blooming make it a notable addition to botanical gardens and tropical landscapes.
